definitions.definition: a sudden increase of a strong feeling

examples.text: She felt a sudden surge of anger.
He thought of his old teacher with a surge of affection.
His initial surge of euphoria was quickly followed by dismay.
A huge surge of emotion swept through her.
He picked up the phone with a surge of panic.

definitions.definition: a sudden increase in the amount or number of something

examples.text: We are having trouble keeping up with the recent surge in demand.
A last-minute surge in ticket sales saved the show from closure.
After an initial surge of interest, there has been little call for our services.

definitions.definition: a sudden, strong movement forward or upwards

examples.text: A surge of people poured through the gates.
Police struggled to control the sudden surge forward by the demonstrators.

definitions.definition: a sudden increase in the flow of electrical power through a system

examples.text: An electrical surge damaged the computer's disk drive.
The National Grid was hit by a huge **power surge**.
